texts.text: $4.95 each month. You can avoid the Monthly Maintenance Fee when you meet ONE of the following requirements during each statement cycle:

texts.label: list_item

texts.text: · Maintain a minimum daily balance of $500 or more in your account, OR

texts.orig: Ways to make payments 1
texts.text: Ways to make payments 1

texts.label: text

texts.text: Pay individuals and businesses using:

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · Your Debit Card: Make purchases and payments at millions of locations.

texts.label: list_item

texts.text: · Online or Mobile Banking transfers: Securely send money to friends, family or coworkers. 3

texts.label: text
texts.orig: NOTE: You can't write personal checks on this account. Any check you write will be returned unpaid, even if you have enough money in your account.
texts.text: NOTE: You can't write personal checks on this account. Any check you write will be returned unpaid, even if you have enough money in your account.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: No bank overdraft fees
texts.text: No bank overdraft fees

texts.label: text
texts.orig: We don't charge overdraft fees on this account. To help you avoid overdrawing your account, transactions will be declined and returned unpaid when you don't have enough money in your account.
texts.text: We don't charge overdraft fees on this account. To help you avoid overdrawing your account, transactions will be declined and returned unpaid when you don't have enough money in your account.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · If this happens, you won't be charged a bank overdraft fee, but the merchant or third party could charge you a fee. For example, you may be charged a late fee if the payment isn't received on time.
texts.text: · If this happens, you won't be charged a bank overdraft fee, but the merchant or third party could charge you a fee. For example, you may be charged a late fee if the payment isn't received on time.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · An owner can set up email or mobile alerts to notify you when you have a low balance in your account or when items aren't paid. (We don't charge for this service but your mobile carrier's message and data fees may apply. Delivery of alerts may be affected or delayed by your mobile carrier's coverage.)
texts.text: · An owner can set up email or mobile alerts to notify you when you have a low balance in your account or when items aren't paid. (We don't charge for this service but your mobile carrier's message and data fees may apply. Delivery of alerts may be affected or delayed by your mobile carrier's coverage.)

texts.label: text
texts.orig: While this account prevents you from overdrawing in most cases, there may still be times when your account could have a negative balance, but we won't charge an overdraft fee. This could happen in the following ways:
texts.text: While this account prevents you from overdrawing in most cases, there may still be times when your account could have a negative balance, but we won't charge an overdraft fee. This could happen in the following ways:

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · When your debit card is authorized for one amount but the final amount is higher (for example, adding a tip at a restaurant or pumping gas)
texts.text: · When your debit card is authorized for one amount but the final amount is higher (for example, adding a tip at a restaurant or pumping gas)

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: • A scheduled bill payment is deducted when you have insufficient funds in your account for the payment
texts.text: • A scheduled bill payment is deducted when you have insufficient funds in your account for the payment

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: • When you get charged a fee, such as a monthly maintenance fee, and the current balance is less than the fee
texts.text: • When you get charged a fee, such as a monthly maintenance fee, and the current balance is less than the fee

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: When your deposits are available
texts.text: When your deposits are available

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · Cash, direct deposits and wire transfers: On the day we receive them. 4
texts.text: · Cash, direct deposits and wire transfers: On the day we receive them. 4

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · Checks you deposit: Usually the next business day, if deposited before the financial center or ATM cutoff time.
texts.text: · Checks you deposit: Usually the next business day, if deposited before the financial center or ATM cutoff time.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · Mobile Check Deposits: Usually the next business day if deposited by applicable cutoff times. Please refer to Deposit Checks , then Help in the Mobile Banking app for additional details and terms and conditions.
texts.text: · Mobile Check Deposits: Usually the next business day if deposited by applicable cutoff times. Please refer to Deposit Checks , then Help in the Mobile Banking app for additional details and terms and conditions.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · If we place a hold on your deposit, we'll let you know the hold reason and when funds will be available for you to use. This is typically provided at the time of deposit but may also be mailed later. Deposits greater than $5,525 and checks deposited within the first 30 days of account opening may be held longer.
texts.text: · If we place a hold on your deposit, we'll let you know the hold reason and when funds will be available for you to use. This is typically provided at the time of deposit but may also be mailed later. Deposits greater than $5,525 and checks deposited within the first 30 days of account opening may be held longer.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: How we post transactions
texts.text: How we post transactions

texts.label: text
texts.orig: The way we post transactions impacts your account balance. At the end of each business day, we'll group transactions received that day into categories before posting them. Below are the most common categories, and common transaction types in each, in the order that they generally post to your account. Keep in mind that transactions that are still processing may lower your available balance.
texts.text: The way we post transactions impacts your account balance. At the end of each business day, we'll group transactions received that day into categories before posting them. Below are the most common categories, and common transaction types in each, in the order that they generally post to your account. Keep in mind that transactions that are still processing may lower your available balance.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · Deposits: Added from highest to lowest dollar amount.
texts.text: · Deposits: Added from highest to lowest dollar amount.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · Many debit transactions: Subtracted based on the date and time you made them. If our system doesn't receive date and time of the transaction, they are posted and subtracted from highest to lowest dollar amount. These include one-time and recurring debit card transactions, one-time transfers and ATM withdrawals.
texts.text: · Many debit transactions: Subtracted based on the date and time you made them. If our system doesn't receive date and time of the transaction, they are posted and subtracted from highest to lowest dollar amount. These include one-time and recurring debit card transactions, one-time transfers and ATM withdrawals.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: · Most other electronic payments and preauthorized transfers: Subtracted from highest to lowest dollar amount. These include scheduled transfers, online bill payments and preauthorized payments that use your account number.
texts.text: · Most other electronic payments and preauthorized transfers: Subtracted from highest to lowest dollar amount. These include scheduled transfers, online bill payments and preauthorized payments that use your account number.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: • Most fees:
texts.text: • Most fees:

texts.label: text
texts.orig: Subtracted from highest to lowest dollar amounts.
texts.text: Subtracted from highest to lowest dollar amounts.

texts.text: Reminder: Paper checks will not work with this account.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: Additional fees
texts.text: Additional fees

texts.label: text
texts.orig: For each outgoing wire transfer sent in U.S. Dollars
texts.text: For each outgoing wire transfer sent in U.S. Dollars

texts.label: text
texts.orig: For international wire transfers, other fees may also apply, including those charged by recipient's financial institution, foreign taxes, and other fees that are part of the wire transfer process. We profit from markups associated with the currency conversion included in our exchange rate (determined solely by us). Before sending in foreign currency, you should consider factors that impact the total cost or the amount available after transfer.
texts.text: For international wire transfers, other fees may also apply, including those charged by recipient's financial institution, foreign taxes, and other fees that are part of the wire transfer process. We profit from markups associated with the currency conversion included in our exchange rate (determined solely by us). Before sending in foreign currency, you should consider factors that impact the total cost or the amount available after transfer.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: Teller Withdrawal
texts.text: Teller Withdrawal

texts.label: text
texts.orig: Per transaction, greater of $5.00 OR 3% of the amount (maximum $10.00) when you use your ATM or debit card, or card number, to make a withdrawal, transfer or payment at another bank and it is processed as a cash disbursement.
texts.text: Per transaction, greater of $5.00 OR 3% of the amount (maximum $10.00) when you use your ATM or debit card, or card number, to make a withdrawal, transfer or payment at another bank and it is processed as a cash disbursement.
